comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.twitch.tv/moonmoon](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.twitch.tv%2Fmoonmoon) ### Comment Username: @Taygahn > When Adguard is running, some elements on twitch won't load. In fact most features of the website are completely broken: the main page of twitch is broken, the video itself doesn't load, no recommended channels and no channel info. Chat works partially, messages load but not user badges. This only happens when Adguard is active, no other extensions or antivirus running, besides Windows's one. When protection is turned off everything works normally, deactivating filters however doesn't help. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/CcV48wp.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/r62HeEF.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Windows v7.11+Beta+2 Browser: | Firefox AdGuard driver: | WFP Stealth mode options: | Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header,
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Block third-party Authorization header,
Self-destructing third-party cookies (180),
Disable cache for third-party requests,
Block WebRTC,
Block Location API,
Block Flash,
Hide your Referrer from third-parties (www.twitch.tv),
Hide your User-Agent () DNS filtering: | server: `https://security.cloudflare-dns.com/dns-query`
filters: `User+rules` Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Mobile Ads,
AdGuard Base

Privacy:

Social Widgets:
AdGuard Social Media

Annoyances:
AdGuard Annoyances

comment.body: After updating the filters just a couple hrs later I'm now getting different behavior.  Even if I disable all annoyances, the images are still being blocked, but if I turn off Ad Blocking -> AdGuard's Base Filter then they load fine.
